result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

*   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

*   Obtain and maintain (full-time) school.
*   Obtain High School Diploma.
*   No contact with Co-Actors Quan L. Jackson, George Fields and Ultiminio L.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: *   Successfully complete 40 hours of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M Fowler

defendant.name: Fowler, Anthony M
defendant.address: 4235 West Fond Du Lac Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53216

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 7/15/2016, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 7/5/2016, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Co-Actors Quan L. Jackson, George Fields and Ultiminio L.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of 
          probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) school.
     *   Successfully complete 40 hours of community
          service.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the
          DNA surcharge.
     *   Obtain High School Diploma.

Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, received and filed

Defendant Anthony M Fowler in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 5/17/2016.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony M Fowler in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Anthony M Fowler in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony M Fowler in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense counsel is seeking a DPA resolution.  Court orders case adjourned for status conference.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony M Fowler in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Anthony M Fowler in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
